page.title: 10FORESTRY IN THE QUANTOCKS
page.content:
The Forestry Commission sold a poplar wood to the private contracter we spoke to.He and one other man start at 8am and finish at 6pm,cutting down about 20 to 30 trees a day.The trees are about 30 years old and there are 62 types of poplar tree,many of the trees are diseased.The two men cut and trim the trees and sell them for use in mines,for sheds and garden fencing.Some of it is sent to Chepstow and made into pulp.When the trees have been felled the wood will be replanted.
The work for this project in the Broomfield area was done by Form 1R of The Castle chool Taunton.
